title: Create subgrid demos to evaluate complexity reduction
description:
Create before/after demos comparing traditional approaches with CSS subgrid to evaluate whether it can reduce code complexity in Vanilla Breeze.

## Reference
See r-n-d/subgrid-exploration.md for full implementation details and CSS code.

## Demo Files to Create
1. docs/examples/demos/subgrid-cards.html - Card grid with aligned headers/footers
2. docs/examples/demos/subgrid-form.html - Form labels aligning across fieldsets
3. docs/examples/demos/subgrid-dl.html - Definition lists with consistent alignment
4. docs/examples/demos/subgrid-article.html - Article + aside sharing row grid

## Each Demo Should Include
- Side-by-side before (current) and after (subgrid) examples
- Code snippets showing CSS difference
- Visual debug grid lines showing alignment

## Evaluation Criteria
After creating demos, evaluate:
- Does subgrid meaningfully reduce CSS complexity?
- Are alignment benefits visible and valuable?
- Any edge cases where subgrid causes problems?

## Decision Point
Based on evaluation:
- If beneficial: Add [data-subgrid] utilities to layout-attributes.css
- If marginal: Document as optional technique only
- If problematic: Document findings, skip integration

## Browser Support
Subgrid is Baseline 2023 - Chrome 117+, Firefox 71+, Safari 16+

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 4 demo files created with before/after comparison
- [ ] Alignment benefits clearly visible in demos
- [ ] Written evaluation of complexity reduction
- [ ] Decision documented on whether to add to core
close_reason: Implemented container queries expansion, grid identity system, and subgrid demos with evaluation

title: Add <ol> list markup to breadcrumb navs for a11y
description:
## Context All 44 breadcrumb `
` elements across the site use bare ``/`` without list markup. VB's CSS already supports `nav.breadcrumb > ol` (provides `display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: center; gap` plus separator styling via `li:not(:last-child)::after`). Adding `
    ` is correct for breadcrumbs since they represent an ordered path. ## Scope 44 instances across two categories: ### Category 1: Site doc pages (~37 instances) Breadcrumbs in Astro pages following this pattern: ```html
    Snippets / Tabs
    ``` Should become: ```html
    1. Snippets
    2. Tabs
    ``` The `/` separator text should be removed — VB's `nav.breadcrumb li:not(:last-child)::after` generates separators via CSS (`content: "/"` by default, configurable via `data-separator`). Files (site/pages/docs/): - snippets/**/*.astro (~12 files) - elements/**/*.astro (~5 files) - examples/extensions/*.astro (~6 files) - integrations/*.astro (2 files) - lab/experiments/*.astro (~4 files) - lab/theme-picker/*.astro (2 files) ### Category 2: Demo HTML pages (~7 instances) Breadcrumbs in example demo pages, mostly single back links like: ```html
    ← Back to Examples
    ``` These single-link breadcrumbs could either: - Get `
      /
    1. ` wrapping for consistency - Or stay as-is since they're just back links (not real breadcrumb trails) Files (docs/examples/demos/): - dashboard-analytics.html, grid-identity.html, layout-attributes.html, layout-attributes-refactored.html, layout-comparison.html, media-basic.html, regions-basic.html ## CSS Already Supports This From `src/native-elements/nav/styles.css`: - `nav ul, nav ol { list-style: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; }` — list reset - `nav.breadcrumb > ol { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: center; gap }` — flex layout - `nav.breadcrumb li:not(:last-child)::after { content: "/" }` — auto separators - Separator variants: `data-separator="chevron|arrow|dot|pipe"` No CSS changes needed. ## Approach 1. Write a script to find all breadcrumb navs and transform them 2. For multi-segment breadcrumbs: wrap in `
        /
      1. `, remove literal `/` separators 3. For single back-link breadcrumbs: add `
          /
        1. ` for consistency 4. Verify `nav.breadcrumb` class is present on all breadcrumb navs (some may be missing it) 5. Build and visually verify separators render correctly
close_reason: All 47 breadcrumb navs across 46 files wrapped in <ol>/<li>. CSS auto-generates separators. Verified build + visual check.

title: Add opt-in grid identity system for page layouts
description:
Extract grid identity concept from zen-garden as opt-in modules. Semantic HTML elements auto-register grid areas based on document structure.

## Reference
See r-n-d/grid-identity-option.md for full implementation details including complete CSS code.

## Concept
Instead of manually assigning grid areas, semantic elements get them automatically:
- body > header → grid-area: body-header
- body > nav → grid-area: body-nav
- main > article → grid-area: main-article

## Deliverables
1. src/custom-elements/layout-grid-identity.css (identity rules)
2. src/custom-elements/layout-page.css (page templates)
3. Demo page showing page-stack, page-sidebar, page-holy-grail layouts

## Key Features
- Opt-in (not in main bundle by default)
- Works with pure semantic HTML
- Includes :has() adaptations (adjust when nav absent)
- Responsive breakpoints built in
- Complementary to existing layout-attributes system

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Grid identity rules work as documented
- [ ] page-sidebar layout demo functional
- [ ] page-holy-grail layout demo functional
- [ ] :has() adaptations work (missing nav)
- [ ] No conflicts with layout-attributes system
- [ ] Works at all responsive breakpoints
close_reason: Implemented container queries expansion, grid identity system, and subgrid demos with evaluation

title: Expand container queries to sectioning elements

## Summary
- Phase 1: Add container-type to sectioning elements
- Phase 2: Add [data-container] utility attributes
- Phase 3: Add container-aware variants to stack/cluster layouts

## Key Files to Modify
- Create src/utils/containers.css (recommended)
- Or add to src/base/reset.css
- Update src/utils/index.css to import

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sectioning elements establish container context
- [ ] Components adapt to container width not viewport
- [ ] No layout shifts or performance regressions
- [ ] Existing demos continue working
